result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Granzow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Granzow to 3 years and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 year &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, concurrent with any other sentence that would be in being at that time.  

The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Granzow on Probation for three years with conditions (which will become conditions of Extended Supervision if Probation is revoked, other than the Jail term)

--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

2/15/17: Court orders that the Court Ordered Financial Obligations (includes Court costs; Victim/Witness; Attorney Fees; Fines and DNA Surcharges) to be made payable to the Jefferson County Clerk of Courts Office. In the amount of $422.76. Defendant shall pay $50 / month beginning 3/31/17 or serve 9 days co. jail c/s.

--no acts or threats of violence to children or anyone 
--to participate in any assessment or treatment as required by the Agent
--no contact with C.J.G. (dob 7/12/13) except as provided in the Children Court proceedings
--contact with children is to be as provided in the Childrens Court proceedings
--to comply with all existing Childrens Courts orders (Jefferson County Case #14JC2)
--not to provide childcare for any child
--not to engage in any physical discipline of any child
--to attempt to maintain employment and/or education program as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: with attached victim restitution request form(s)
With JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Reserve Judge Klossner presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 9:03am. 
Defendant Anthony M Granzow in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Constitutional rights reviewed;  plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Shock submits the victim impact statement); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Granzow guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Granzow to 3 years and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1 year &  6 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years, concurrent with any other sentence that would be in being at that time.  

The Court finds that Mr. Granzow is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp" or the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 2 days credit for time already served.

The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Granzow on Probation for three years with conditions (which will become conditions of Extended Supervision if Probation is revoked, other than the Jail term):
--to serve four months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith
--no acts or threats of violence to children or anyone 
--to participate in any assessment or treatment as required by the Agent
--no contact with C.J.G. (dob 7/12/13) except as provided in the Children Court proceedings
--contact with children is to be as provided in the Childrens Court proceedings
--to comply with all existing Childrens Courts orders (Jefferson County Case #14JC2)
--not to provide childcare for any child
--not to engage in any physical discipline of any child
--to attempt to maintain employment and/or education program as required by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

Preliminary hearing on January 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Scheduling Notice

Case called at 1:40 pm
Defendant Anthony M. Granzow in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $3,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with CJG (dob 7/12/13) or Jasmine Brantmeyer
-No presence at any address the child's mother or the child may reside at, except may return to any residence where Ms. Jasmine Brantmeyer may be residing to obtain his personal belongings on one occassion with law enforcement 

Attornery Zarwell informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 20 day time limit (requested by the State)
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient.
 
Recess: 1:48 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 1/24/14 at 8:30 am
